image.altText: A graphic of a street with streetlights changing their intensity. Stars in the sky become more visible as the lights are dimmed.

props.synopsis: An "adaptive lighting" project in Canberra, which reduced the brightness of streetlights by up to half, showed a 25 per cent reduction in light pollution.

title.children: Turning down streetlights at night shown to reduce light pollution and carbon emissions

image.altText: Micaela Cronin stares up on stage at the national press club.

props.synopsis: Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence Commissioner Micaela Cronin addressed the National Press Club on Wednesday facing a room almost entirely of women, but it seemed she was trying to reach the ears of a different demographic.

title.children: Australia just got graded on how it's tackling violence against women, and it's a C-

image.altText: CSIRO scientist in lab

props.synopsis: An estimated 200 scientific roles have already been earmarked for axing as the union says the move is a "dark day" for science.

title.children: CSIRO to cut up to 500 jobs as part of agency restructure

image.altText: A woman sitting on a footstool in front of a couch smiles at the camerra.

props.synopsis: The Canberra centre offers up to 12 people with common eating disorders like anorexia nervosa, bulimia and binge-eating disorder 24/7 sub-acute care from a multidisciplinary team.

title.children: Australia-first eating disorder treatment centre offers 'place that feels like home' to patients in Canberra

image.altText: The sign out of the front of the building and the crest, with an autumnal tree nearby and a blue sky beyond.

props.synopsis: The woman had gone to a Canberra shopping centre and was returning to her car when a man attacked her and demanded her keys.

title.children: Woman stabbed during carjacking while out shopping tells court she lives with 'intense daily fear'

image.altText: Two women sit at a table looking seriously at an open laptop.

props.synopsis: Just two months after its inaugural flight landed, Batik Air has reduced the number of direct flights from Canberra to Denpasar in Bali from three-a-week to two.

title.children: When flight cancellations derailed Jo and Ellie's long-awaited Bali holiday, they thought it was a scam

image.altText: A woman sits at a table with a pile of flash cards with words on them.

props.synopsis: Emily Lewis's son struggled with learning to read in kindergarten and, despite being assured by his teachers that there was no need for concern, he was still lagging behind by year 2.

title.children: Emily's son struggled learning to read in public school, something the Canberra Liberals' education policy hopes to change

image.altText: a woman with brown hair and glasses with a pile of textbooks and a laptop in front of her

props.synopsis: The mature age physiotherapy student is battling what's known as "placement poverty".

title.children: These students have to do 1,000 hours of unpaid work but the bills don't stop piling up

image.altText: Drone shot of the top of a house without a roof.

props.synopsis: A class action has been filed against the West Australian government on behalf of thousands of tenants living in substandard public housing in remote Aboriginal communities.

title.children: These Australians have been 'ignored and forgotten' in the housing crisis

image.altText: ppl

props.synopsis: New laws to pay superannuation on government-funded paid parental leave has been introduced to parliament. Follow live.

title.children: New paid parental leave laws a 'game changer' for parents

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Defence not commenting on use of Australian donated Bushmasters inside Russia
Labor MP announces retirement from politics

image.altText: Bill Shorten during QT

props.synopsis: The federal government has cleared its political hurdle with states and territories to reform the NDIS, but it now faces a very apprehensive disability community.

title.children: What happens now the government has support for its contentious NDIS reforms?

props.synopsis: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz will formally accept the Democratic party nomination for vice-president on the third day of the Democratic National Convention, where former US president Bill Clinton will give the keynote speech. Follow live.

title.children: Nancy Pelosi takes to stage after Clinton warns Democratic National Convention to 'never underestimate' Trump

image.altText: Aftermath of missile attack in Russia's Kursk

props.synopsis: Russia's Ministry of Defence says it shot down a swathe of Ukrainian drones in one of Kyiv's "largest attempts" to attack Moscow using drones.

title.children: Kyiv's Russian counteroffensive continues with 'largest' attempted drone attack

image.altText: A shot of the horizon with a massive column of water and air running vertically

props.synopsis: A weather phenomenon called a waterspout may have sunk a luxury yacht off Italy this week. But these dangerous spirals of water also happen a lot closer to home.

title.children: Could a waterspout really sink a luxury yacht? Everything you need to know about the rare weather phenomenon

image.altText: A man wearing a white tshirt and shorts, taking a photo by the beach as the sun sets.

props.synopsis: Above-average temperatures are forecast all across Australia as we reach the tail end of winter. But is the cold weather truly behind us?

title.children: Summer heat arrives in August, threatening to break all-time Australian winter temperature records

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and his government stand up in parliament with their hands clasped, looking solemn.

props.synopsis: Beyond the heat in the chamber, the two sides of politics have been quietly working together behind the scenes on important reforms.

title.children: Beyond the arguments and name-calling, the two sides of politics have been quietly working together

image.altText: Pink roses.

props.synopsis: A bouquet of flowers is the go-to gift for many special occasions but the world is paying a high price for transporting our out-of-season blooms.

title.children: The ugly truth behind the cheap flowers we buy at the supermarket checkout

image.altText: A graphic reading death certificate

props.synopsis: Medical staff at Tasmania's second-largest hospital say what the public know is just "the tip of the iceberg" when it comes to unexpected deaths going unreported to the coroner.

title.children: Hospital staff break silence after allegations former head of medical services falsified death certificates

image.altText: A regional express airplane

props.synopsis: Hundreds of former Rex employees could face an even longer wait to be paid their entitlements after administrators applied for an extension to find a buyer for the airline.

title.children: Rex administrators seek to extend sales process for troubled airline

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: There are fresh warnings that Australia's economy is heading toward a recession, as Deloitte flags a private sector hiring freeze. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Bank of Queensland confirms 400 job cuts, ASX to open higher despite economy warnings

image.altText: Five rescue workers sit in high-viz outfits on a boat

props.synopsis: The discoveries bring the number of people killed in the incident to six, with authorities still searching for one other passenger.

title.children: Five bodies found in billionaire Mike Lynch's superyacht, which sank off Italian coast

image.altText: A person looks out at steam rising from a volcano.

props.synopsis: Volcanic ash has disrupted flight paths for nearby airports after an eruption at Whakaari.

title.children: At least 10 flights cancelled after volcanic ash, eruption at Whakaari White Island

image.altText: Donald Trump stands behind bullletproof glass onstage at an outdoor rally.

props.synopsis: At his first outdoor rally since last month's attempted assassination, Donald Trump spoke from behind bulletproof glass, but he also casually wandered out to greet crowds.

title.children: Trump speaks behind bulletproof glass at first outdoor rally since attempted assassination

image.altText: Jannik Sinner plays a double-fisted backhand against Novak Djokovic at the 2024 Australian Open.

props.synopsis: One of Jannik Sinner's coaches, Australian Darren Cahill, says the men's world number one deserves to have a clear conscience amid calls he should have served a suspension for testing positive to an anabolic agent.

title.children: 'This won't affect Jannik's legacy in the game': Sinner defended after returning positive doping tests

image.altText: A portrait photo of Elon Musk. He is a white man with short black hair and brown eyes, wearing a black suit.

props.synopsis: Data provided exclusively to the ABC shows Tesla's "brand health" in Australia has plummeted as some EV buyers say, "Musk has convinced me I don't want to buy a Tesla".

title.children: Does Tesla have a Musk problem? Data shows its reputation in Australia is tanking as sales fall

image.altText: A woman sitting on a couch cuddling a newborn baby, both are asleep.

props.synopsis: Ariane Beeston worked as a child protection officer for years, but she didn't realise how much the trauma of her work had impacted her until she had a child of her own.

title.children: How the vicarious trauma of a job led to this mother's postnatal psychosis

image.altText: A river winding through bushland with cleared land in the distance.

props.synopsis: FOI documents shared with the ABC reveal current chief minister Eva Lawler approved the NT's largest water plan while the environment minister was on holiday, with no water advisory committee and against the wishes of traditional owners.

title.children: Current NT chief minister approved controversial water plan while environment minister was on holiday

image.altText: Comanchero Outlaw Motorcycle Gang clothing, methamphetamine, phones, cash and other items laid out on the ground.

props.synopsis: Police in Tonga say an alleged Comancheros gang member deported from Australia was behind moves to establish the outlaw motorcycle group in the Pacific island — an attempt they say was disrupted in a drug bust this month.

title.children: Tonga police swoop on alleged Comanchero gang member once deported from Australia

image.altText: A large group of people, many Indigenous, standing in a bush clearing with Prime Minister Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: Young Aboriginal people say they are fed up with abuses of power from those in authority, empty promises and a culturally insensitive education system. At the NT's Garma Festival, they got together to create a vision for the future.

title.children: Indigenous teens issue powerful call for overhaul of 'traumatising' school system

image.altText: Pile of frozen pea packets

props.synopsis: Supermarkets are seemingly offering more brands of frozen veggies than ever — but is the increasing choice an illusion?

title.children: The rise of 'phantom brands' as supermarket giants sneak imports onto shelves, pushing Australian produce out

image.altText: A man and woman look at each other smiling.

props.synopsis: A young Christian nurse in Central Australia got pregnant in the 1950s. Her birth son spent two decades trying to find her.

title.children: Sol took himself across the world to find his birth mother

image.altText: Silver bullion bars

props.synopsis: Australian companies are hoping to capitalise on the rising silver prices, with some analysts predicting the commodity could reach $US100 an ounce in coming years.

title.children: Silver prices rising sharply with miners hoping to reap the rewards

image.altText: A woman sitting on a kerb.

props.synopsis: Moreton Bay City Council has threatened to call the police on homeless people if they do not leave the foreshore to make way for a food and wine festival.

title.children: Homeless told to move on by council ahead of food and wine festival after being deemed 'safety risk'

image.altText: Group of penguins stand near inflatable rainbow

props.synopsis: Sphen the gentoo penguin made international headlines in 2018 after entering a same-sex relationship with fellow penguin Magic, who he raised two chicks with.

title.children: World-famous penguin known for same-sex love story dies at Sydney aquarium
